group_1.textCenter: Back when we lived in our hometown…
I was so shy and unconfident in everything I did.
Well admittedly, things haven't really changed@on that front…
Heruka, on the other hand, was always sure@of herself.
She was mature beyond her years, intelligent,@and taller than the other children our age...
Well, I'm taller than her now. *Giggle*
Back to the point...@Heruka has a charisma I can't put in words,
so all the kids our age were always following@her around…
And I was no different.@I liked following her.
But…to tell you the truth, I was also jealous.
We were born on the same day, and have always@been together, but ended up so different.
I was so envious of her…!
I hated it… I hated having those ugly feelings@for the one I cared so much about.

group_1.narration: That was when Heruka took me@to the field full of blue poppies in bloom.
Those flowers aren't all that rare in those parts.@What's more, they're ugly.@I'd never once thought they were pretty.
And yet it was such a beautiful sight...
Even if each flower on its own@is ugly and lacks any beauty at all,@I realized there was still a place where@even they can look beautiful...
Even though I'm nothing special,@I felt like I could still matter...

group_1.textCenter: ...But where was that field of poppies?
I've been looking for it again ever since that day,@but I still can't find it.
Honestly, I get the feeling I'll never find@it again…
It just feels like that sort of place.
Anyway...Heruka is so special to me.
She's an incredible person who always comes@to my aid again and again...

group_1.narration: …I wasn't the only one who felt that way, either.
One time, Heruka and I were visiting a cave@when we got trapped inside after a landslide.
By chance, however, Heruka found an opening.@I followed her lead and helped clear out@the mud and rocks, and we escaped.
After we got home, everyone proclaimed Heruka@as an extraordinary being, that she was the savior@who would deliver us from the Mongolian Army.

group_1.textCenter: I didn't want Heruka to be special for everyone.@I wanted her to be special for me and me alone.
I didn't want her to be a savior.
I just wanted her to keep being@my beloved Heruka.
She's special to me in a different way@from how everyone else sees her!
…And yet…@I can't…
There's some part of me that DOES think@Heruka is the savior…
I've come to see that she is an extraordinary@being in that way.

group_1.textLeft: But I didn't want to admit that,@so I tried being the special one instead.
Like, if I'm special, then Heruka doesn't need to@take on that burden, you know what I mean?
But that was all for nothing in the end…
But still...it makes sense she'd do that.@I went on for way too long...

group_1.narration: I'm still scared of the night.@Is it because it was nighttime@when our hometown was burned?@Or is it because it reminds me@that I could do nothing to stop it?
No... In this utter darkness,@I'm scared that I'm going to become one@more blind devotee clinging onto Heruka.
I'm scared that I won't be able@to be friends with Heruka anymore.
